Message.Msg: And with no good to monetize mobile and click rate profits down, earnings Monday close are going to be a disaster, just like Google. Top and bottom lines both down. Get out, buy puts or sell short now. I'm so short I could do chin-ups off a dime right now. Wednesday will be a big payday.

Message.Title: quote of the decade
Message.Msg: "The fact that we are here today to debate raising America's debt limit is a sign of leadership failure. It is a sign that the US Government cannot pay its own bills. It is a sign that we now depend on ongoing financial assistance from foreign countries to finance our Government's reckless fiscal policies. Increasing America 's debt weakens us domestically and internationally. Leadership means that, "the buck stops here.' Instead, Washington is shifting the burden of bad choices today onto the backs of our children and grandchildren. America has a debt problem and a failure of leadership. Americans deserve better." ~ Senator Barack H. Obama, March 2006~

Message.Title: It's not going to happen
Message.Msg: Despite what Mayer wants to do with Yahoo! Inc. - she wants to the get the company back to its "roots" - thanks to her ex-boss, Jerry Yang - she will be able to do no such thing! Her stupid #$%$ ex-boss - Jerry Yang - ran the company into the ground, long after Yahoo!'s glory days. Dumb #$%$ Yang should have sold the company, when Microsoft came calling. This company is finished. Just have a look at this company's price chart over the last 5-10 years.

Message.Title: Short.. It is the obvious trade after GOOG warning...

Topic.Title: Yahoo bashers afraid to answer earnings poll

Message.Msg: Nobody cares. Earnings estimates are always wrong anyway. Analysts and companies always play their silly game of revise down, revise down, so the companies will meet or exceed their stupid #$%$ estimates, and then everyone is happy. I call the whole analyst estimates business a shell game. #$%$ the earnings per share estimates and concentrate on the actual CASH a company generates and returns to shareholders or keeps to grow the business. At the end of the day, reported net income does NOT pay the bills.
